intro: Hedeoma pulegioides, commonly known as wild mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves that have a strong minty scent. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or blue and bloom in clusters during the summer months. Hedeoma pulegioides is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in shaded woodlands.
